Class Card

java.lang.Object
Card
class Card
extends java.lang.Object
Class representing individual cards that compose the Hand and Deck classes
Author:
Larry Chiem, Ian Rowe, Raymond Shum, Nicholas Stankovich

  • Method Details

    • set

      public boolean set​(char val, Card.Suit st)
      Sets value and suit. If successful, sets errorFlag to false and returns true, if not successful sets errorFlag true and returns false.
      Parameters:
      val - char presenting value of card
      st - enum representing suit of card
      Returns:
      boolean TRUE if passed parameters can be set and FALSE if not

    • isValid

      private boolean isValid​(char val, Card.Suit st)
      returns true if a valid value and suit are given, false otherwise
      Parameters:
      val - char presenting value of card
      st - enum representing suit of card
      Returns:
      boolean true if a valid value and suit are given, false otherwise

    • toString

      public java.lang.String toString()
      Returns a string containing the value and suit of the card if errorFlag is false, returns "[INVALID]" otherwise
      Overrides:
      toString in class java.lang.Object
      Returns:
      Returns a string containing the value and suit of the card

      public boolean equals​(Card card)

      Parameters:

      Returns:
      boolean true equivalent, false otherwise

    • arraySort

      public static void arraySort​(Card[] cards, int arraySize)
      Bubble sort method applied to incoming array of cards
      Parameters:
      cards - array to be sorted
      arraySize - number of cards in cards parameter

    • findRank

      private static int findRank​(char element)
      Returns integer representing relative value of card (low to high), compared against position of valuRanks array
      Parameters:
      element - char to be compared against valuRanks array
      Returns:
      int 1 if element exists and -1 if it does not
